_comments._editing_guide: The fields below can be edited to customize the department page content. These texts will appear on the public website.
_comments._introText: Short introduction that appears at the top of the department page
_comments._descriptionText: Detailed description - you can use placeholder variables like {jurisdiction.name}, {department.name}, etc.
_comments._roleText: Description of the department's role and importance to the province
_comments._programsHeading: Heading for the programs and services section
_comments._programsDescription: Description of what programs and services this department offers

introText: The Ministry of the Attorney General oversees Ontario's justice system, including courts, legal services, and access to justice programs, ensuring fair and effective legal services for all Ontarians.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of the Attorney General spent $2.1B in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 1.0% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports courts, legal aid, and justice services.
roleText: The justice system is fundamental to the rule of law and democratic society. This ministry operates courts, provides legal services, supports victims, and ensures access to justice for all Ontarians.
programsDescription: The Ministry of the Attorney General operates programs including court services, Legal Aid Ontario, victim services, Indigenous justice programs, prosecution services, and human rights support.
